structure.unit: RIOT, DISORDERLY CONDUCT, AND RELATED OFFENSES

text.section:
A person is guilty of riot in the first degree when:
He knowingly participates in a riot; and
In the course of and as a result of such riot a person other than one (1) of the participants suffers physical injury or substantial property damage occurs.
Riot in the first degree is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 212, effective January 1, 1975.
